channel.title: Comments on: How to get SSO for Facebook working with XPages

item.title: By: Peter NÃ¤rlund
item.dc:creator: Peter NÃ¤rlund
item.description: <p>Check out real authentication using http://simply-sso.com./ No need to handel domino passwords...</p>
item.content:encoded: Check out real authentication using http://simply-sso.com/. No need to handel domino passwords…

item.title: By: Vikas Tiwari
item.dc:creator: Vikas Tiwari
item.description: <p>Hi Matt, </p><p>Thanks for the wonderful code. </p><p>I am facing issue with sessionAsSigner in afterPageLoad event. Server is 8.5.2, still giving error: sessionAsSigner not found. It works if I use sessionAsSigner within onClick event of a button but not with XPage events.</p><p>Please suggest if anyone else has faced such issue ?</p>
item.content:encoded:
Hi Matt,

Thanks for the wonderful code.

I am facing issue with sessionAsSigner in afterPageLoad event. Server is 8.5.2, still giving error: sessionAsSigner not found. It works if I use sessionAsSigner within onClick event of a button but not with XPage events.

Please suggest if anyone else has faced such issue ?

item.title: By: Julian Buss
item.dc:creator: Julian Buss
item.description: <p>sorry for my comment, I didn't read until the end.. :-) Now I know where the password's coming from.</p>
item.content:encoded: sorry for my comment, I didn't read until the end.. ðŸ™‚ Now I know where the password's coming from.

item.title: By: Nathan T. Freeman
item.dc:creator: Nathan T. Freeman
item.description: <p>Matt, can I suggest adding the following to your registerNewFBUser function?</p><p>docPerson.replaceItemValue("$SecurePassword", "2");</p><p>Theoretically the .computeWithForm call will enforce whatever password storage policy you've set in the directory, but I've personally found it a good idea to enforce the salted storage as much as possible.</p><p>Nice use of the fb uid as a custom OU there. Very slick. ;-)</p>
item.content:encoded:
Matt, can I suggest adding the following to your registerNewFBUser function?

docPerson.replaceItemValue("$SecurePassword", "2");

Theoretically the .computeWithForm call will enforce whatever password storage policy you've set in the directory, but I've personally found it a good idea to enforce the salted storage as much as possible.

Nice use of the fb uid as a custom OU there. Very slick. ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Julian Buss
item.dc:creator: Julian Buss
item.description: <p>nice one, Matt. <br/>I always wondered how one could create SSO solutions for Domino using "foreign" authentication, but it makes sense the way you did it. <br/>What puzzles me is that it seems you can read the user's password from his facebook account (since you create a new person document and writing that password into the httppassword field)? <br/>Or is this some kind of generated password, created by the facebook system?</p>
item.content:encoded:
nice one, Matt.
I always wondered how one could create SSO solutions for Domino using "foreign" authentication, but it makes sense the way you did it.
What puzzles me is that it seems you can read the user's password from his facebook account (since you create a new person document and writing that password into the httppassword field)?
Or is this some kind of generated password, created by the facebook system?

item.title: By: Fredrik
item.dc:creator: Fredrik
item.description: <p>Thanks for sharing Matt, perhaps plublish this on openntf.org as a demo app would be great next step.</p>
item.content:encoded: Thanks for sharing Matt, perhaps plublish this on openntf.org as a demo app would be great next step.

item.title: By: Mark Barton
item.dc:creator: Mark Barton
item.description: <p>Ah - doing the AJAX HTTP Post to perform the login is a nice touch saves having to create the token.</p><p>Thanks for posting this Matt.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Ah – doing the AJAX HTTP Post to perform the login is a nice touch saves having to create the token.

Thanks for posting this Matt.

item.title: By: JJTB Somhorst
item.dc:creator: JJTB Somhorst
item.description: <p>The integration with facebook is an awsome step to make xpages even more nice. I think it would be possible to do the same with for instance twitter?</p>
item.content:encoded: The integration with facebook is an awsome step to make xpages even more nice. I think it would be possible to do the same with for instance twitter?
